articles.headline: Ronan Farrow Goes After NBC News Executives in His New Book
articles.snippet: In “Catch and Kill,” the reporter says they blocked his monthslong investigation of Harvey Weinstein. The network disputes his claims.
articles.abstract: In “Catch and Kill,” the reporter says they blocked his monthslong investigation of Harvey Weinstein. The network disputes his claims.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a step-by-step account in his new book, the investigative journalist Ronan Farrow accuses high-level executives and producers at NBC News of interfering with his monthslong effort to report on the film mogul Harvey Weinstein, an investigation that would become part of the prizewinning series he published in The New Yorker after leaving the network in 2017.

articles.headline: For the Most Vulnerable, California Blackouts ‘Can Be Life or Death’
articles.snippet: As the widespread outages in the state continued for a second day, fears grew for sick and older residents and those who rely on medical equipment.
articles.abstract: As the widespread outages in the state continued for a second day, fears grew for sick and older residents and those who rely on medical equipment.
articles.lead_paragraph: MORAGA, Calif. — When Ben Faus went to bed at his home in the foothills above the Monterey Bay, he knew there was a chance his power would go out but he didn’t know exactly when. About 3 a.m. on Thursday he was jolted awake because his sleep apnea breathing machine stopped working.

articles.headline: Giuliani Pressed for Turkish Prisoner Swap in Oval Office Meeting
articles.snippet: The lawyer had asked that President Trump and Rex Tillerson, then secretary of state, help a client who was accused in a more than $10 billion scheme to thwart sanctions on Iran.
articles.abstract: The lawyer had asked that President Trump and Rex Tillerson, then secretary of state, help a client who was accused in a more than $10 billion scheme to thwart sanctions on Iran.
articles.lead_paragraph: During a contentious Oval Office meeting with President Trump and Secretary of State Rex Tillerson in 2017, Rudolph W. Giuliani pressed for help in securing the release of a jailed client, an Iranian-Turkish gold trader, as part of a potential prisoner swap with Turkey.
articles.byline: By Jo Becker, Maggie Haberman and Eric Lipton

articles.headline: Giuliani’s Ukraine Team: In Search of Influence, Dirt and Money
articles.snippet: The president’s lawyer was paid by Lev Parnas, who with Igor Fruman worked on behalf of President Trump in Ukraine.
articles.abstract: The president’s lawyer was paid by Lev Parnas, who with Igor Fruman worked on behalf of President Trump in Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Rudolph W. Giuliani set out to dredge up damaging information on President Trump’s rivals in Ukraine, he turned to a native of the former Soviet republic with whom he already had a lucrative business relationship.

articles.headline: Netflix Goes All Out to Wow Children as Streaming Wars Intensify
articles.snippet: Faced with new competition like Disney Plus, the streaming service has quietly prepared a barrage of shows and movies for children and families.
articles.abstract: Faced with new competition like Disney Plus, the streaming service has quietly prepared a barrage of shows and movies for children and families.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Walk the halls of Netflix Animation, spread across three buildings in the heart of Hollywood, and a cheeky question may cross your mind: Is anyone left at Disney Channel headquarters?

articles.headline: Boeing and F.A.A. Faulted in Damning Report on 737 Max Certification
articles.snippet: A task force found that Boeing did not adequately describe the system that contributed to two crashes, and that the F.A.A. failed to understand much of what the company did share.
articles.abstract: A task force found that Boeing did not adequately describe the system that contributed to two crashes, and that the F.A.A. failed to understand much of what the company did share.
articles.lead_paragraph: A breakdown in the nation’s regulatory system and poor communication from Boeing compromised the safety of the 737 Max jet before it crashed twice in five months and killed 346 people, according to a damning report released Friday.
articles.byline: By David Gelles and Natalie Kitroeff

articles.headline: ISIS Rears Its Head, Adding to Chaos as Turkey Battles Kurds
articles.snippet: A prison break and a bombing claimed by the Islamic State punctuated fears that the Turkish invasion, now in its third day, was sowing mayhem.
articles.abstract: A prison break and a bombing claimed by the Islamic State punctuated fears that the Turkish invasion, now in its third day, was sowing mayhem.
articles.lead_paragraph: CEYLANPINAR, Turkey — The Turkish invasion of Kurdish-held territory in northern Syria raised new fears of a resurgence of the Islamic State on Friday, as five militants escaped from a Kurdish-run prison and the extremist group claimed responsibility for a bomb that exploded in the regional capital.
articles.byline: By Carlotta Gall and Patrick Kingsley

articles.headline: Ukraine Envoy Says She Was Told Trump Wanted Her Out Over Lack of Trust
articles.snippet: Ambassador Marie L. Yovanovitch was recalled from Ukraine after a long campaign against her by Rudolph Giuliani and his allies. Her boss told her she had “done nothing wrong.”
articles.abstract: Ambassador Marie L. Yovanovitch was recalled from Ukraine after a long campaign against her by Rudolph Giuliani and his allies. Her boss told her she had “done nothing wrong.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The State Department’s request went in early March to Marie L. Yovanovitch, a longtime diplomat who had served six presidents: Would she extend her term as ambassador to Ukraine, scheduled to end in August, into 2020?
articles.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere, Nicholas Fandos and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: Trump Reaches ‘Phase 1’ Deal With China and Delays Planned Tariffs
articles.snippet: President Trump said he had reached an agreement with China to walk back tensions in the trade war as he met with a top Chinese envoy Friday
articles.abstract: President Trump said he had reached an agreement with China to walk back tensions in the trade war as he met with a top Chinese envoy Friday
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said Friday that the United States had reached an interim deal with China that would forestall a tariff increase slated for next week, providing a temporary détente in a prolonged and economically painful trade war.
